detaileddescription.para: This directory contains the source files for the Proto project's official documentation.
The documentation is built using Sphinx, a powerful documentation generator, and Doxygen, which is used to generate API references directly from the C++ source code comments.

sect1.title: Prerequisites
sect1.para: Before you can build the documentation, you need to ensure the following tools are installed on your system:

listitem.para: Breathe: A Sphinx extension that acts as a bridge to Doxygen.
Doxygen: The tool used to extract documentation from the C++ source files.

sect1.title: Building the Documentation
sect1.para: The build process is managed by CMake, which will first run Doxygen and then Sphinx.

listitem.para: Configure the project (if you haven't already) from the root directory: bash mkdir build cd build cmake ..

Build the docs target from within the build directory: bash make docs This command will first run Doxygen to generate XML files from the C++ source code and then run Sphinx to convert the .rst source files and the Doxygen output into a polished HTML website.

sect1.title: Viewing the Documentation
